NADs have the role of authenticators

questions.question_text: Which device acts as an authenticator during the 802.1X authentication process?

An engineer must use certificate authentication for endpoints that connect to a wired network with a Cisco ISE deployment. The engineer must define the certificate field used as the principal username. What is needed to complete the configuration?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
Go to Administration > Identity Management > External Identity Sources > Certificate Authentication Profiles.

questions.question_text: What is a difference between TACACS+ compared to RADIUS? (Choose two.)

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: BD
Radius only encrypts the password while tacacs+ encrypts the entire packet
Radius protocol also supports 802.1x

choices.B: TACACS+ uses a connection-oriented transport, and RADIUS uses a connectionless transport.
choices.C: TACACS+ supports 802.1X network access control, and RADIUS supports only MAB.
choices.D: TACACS+ offers multiple protocol support, and RADIUS supports only IP traffic.
choices.A: TACACS+ encrypts only the password, and RADIUS encrypts the entire packet payload.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
A is correct. a continue is an authentication override option in the authentication policy rule. technically it is an "access-accept" used as an override of negative auth result from database. Used the typical Mab rule config of Web Authentication for unknow devices such as guest or contractors.

discussion.content:

Correct is C.

Client Provisioning Resources

 Agent resources from local disk: Select resources on your PC that you want to upload to ISE, see Add Cisco Provided Client Provisioning Resources from a Local Machine.

 Native Supplicant Profile: Configure a supplicant profile for phones and tablets that contain settings for your network. For more information, see Create Native Supplicant Profiles.

 AnyConnect ISE Posture Profile: Configure the AnyConnect ISE Posture here when you don't want to create and distribute agent XML profiles. For more information about the AnyConnect ISE Posture agent and ISE Posture Profile Editor, see the AnyConnect Administrators Guide for your version of AnyConnect https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/support/security/anyconnect-secure-mobility-client/products-installation-and-configuration-guides-list.html.


https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/security/ise/3-1/admin_guide/b_ise_admin_3_1/b_ISE_admin_31_compliance.html#id_17065

Selected Answer: C
You do not upload compliance modules through any portal. It must be done through the PAN.
Under Policy>Results>Client Provisioning>Resources you can upload. In this case because you first downloaded the compliance module you would select agent resources from local disk.

Selected Answer: A
To upload a compliance module on a Cisco ISE network, you would access the "Client Provisioning Portal" within the "Work Centers" section of the ISE interface, where you can navigate to "Posture > Client Provisioning > Resources" to upload the compliance module file directly to the platform; essentially allowing you to define the compliance checks that devices must pass before accessing the network

questions.question_text: An administrator must deploy the Cisco Secure Client posture agent to employee endpoints that access a wireless network by using URL redirection in Cisco ISE. The compliance module must be downloaded from Cisco and uploaded to the Cisco ISE client provisioning resource. What must be used to upload the compliance module?

choices.C: agent resources from the local disk
